titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 803) to designate certain lands in the State of Colorado as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex, gender identity, and sexual orientation, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 803) to designate certain lands in the State of Colorado as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System, and for other purposes, and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 5) to prohibit discrimination on the basis of sex, gender identity, and sexual orientation, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 117-6, by Ms. Scanlon.
Rule provides for 1 hour of general debate on H.R. 803 and one motion to recommit. Rule provides for 90 minutes of general debate on H.R. 5 and one motion to recommit.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 6.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 147.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 219 - 211 (Roll no. 34).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 208 (Roll no. 35).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: This resolution sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 803 (Colorado Wilderness Act of 2021) and H.R. 5 (Equality Act).
